thread.title: Current, former MLB players die in wrecks: reports
thread.title_full: Current, former MLB players die in wrecks: reports

title: Current, former MLB players die in wrecks: reports
text:
Stumble 
Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Yordano Ventura died Sunday at the age of 25 after a car accident in his native Dominican Republic, reports say. 
Ventura went 11-12 in the 2016 season and posted a 4.45 ERA. He was a member of the Royals’ 2015 World Series-winning team. 
Andy Marte #28 of the Arizona Diamondbacks makes a play on a bouncing ball during the fifth inning against the Pittsburgh Pirates Norm Hall, Getty Images 
In a separate incident, also in the Dominican Republic, former MLB player Andy Marte was also killed in a car accident, reports CBSSports.com . He was 33. 
Once a top prospect, Marte played parts of seven MLB seasons with the Atlanta Braves, Cleveland Indians and Arizona Diamondbacks. Most recently, he played for the KT Wiz in the Korean Baseball Association. © 2017 CBS Interactive Inc. All Rights Reserved.
